intro: Alchornea conceveiboides, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has alternate, simple leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape. Its sap is milky and can be toxic, which is a common trait among members of the Euphorbiaceae family. Alchornea conceveiboides is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
